703836f-a.title: Brooklyn: Court Street - Remsen Street
703836f-a.text:
Court Street, west side, between Remsen and Joralemon Streets. A
view across Borough Hall Park in which is erected a statue to Henry
Ward Beecher. At the left is a section of Borough Hall.
1910.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
703836f-a.folder: Court Street & Remsen Street, Brooklyn, NY

706472f-a.title: Brooklyn: Remsen Street - Court Street
706472f-a.text:
(1)
Remsen Street, west from Court Street, showing part of the corner
building which housed Hooley's Opera House, in 1861 or 1862. The Dime
Savings Bank, organised in 1859, occupied this site,from 1884.
About 1882.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
(2)
The same, showing the corner. Now (1936) a 23-story building
occupies this site.
About 1915.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
706472f-a.folder: Remsen Street & Court Street, Brooklyn, NY

706473f-a.title: Brooklyn: Remsen Street - Court Street
706473f-a.text:
Remsen Street, west from, and including Court Street. Also seOn
is Court Stre et, from, but not including Hontague Street, to, but not in-
cluding Joralemon Strcet. Iu the entreme right, is the Old Phenix
Insurance Puilding, no~ gone; the new building is 16 Court Street. In
the extreme laft, is the front of the Brooklyn Municipal bullding, and the
top part of it showing the clock tower still functioning.
)ay 1926.
Brown Brothers.
NO REPEODUCTIONS.
706473f-a.folder: Remsen Street & Court Street, Brooklyn, NY

706468f-a.title: Brooklyn: Remsen Street - Court Street
706468f-a.text:
Remsen Street, south side, near Court Street, showing several brownstone
houses that are to be converted into offices of the Brooklyn Union Gas Co.
1923.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
